item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 19, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: New world record – verified Goldbach Conjecture up to 4*10^18+7*10^13 (57 points | 13 comments)
2. Cozy video games can quell stress and anxiety (380 points | 219 comments)
3. 15,000 lines of verified cryptography now in Python (340 points | 91 comments)
4. High time to tackle drug-resistant fungal infections (39 points | 7 comments)
5. Full Text Search of US Court records (271 points | 50 comments)
6. Show HN: I made a Doom-like game fit inside a QR code (403 points | 116 comments)
7. Hands-On Large Language Models (87 points | 5 comments)
8. JavaScript Views, the Hard Way – A Pattern for Writing UI (72 points | 34 comments)
9. AI-Designed Antivenoms: New Proteins to Block Deadly Snake Toxins (37 points | 3 comments)
10. Ocean Iron Fertilization (50 points | 33 comments)
11. The British sitcom that swept through the Balkans (2023) (5 points | 1 comment)
12. Investigating the Luna-Terra Collapse as a Temporal Multilayer Graph (16 points | 3 comments)
13. Understanding the Origins and the Evolution of Vi and Vim (174 points | 70 comments)

15. Hypertext TV (147 points | 15 comments)

18. Cyberpunk 1958: The Early Days of the Polish IT Industry (135 points | 14 comments)

20. There's Life Inside Earth's Crust (96 points | 30 comments)
21. UML diagram for the DDD example in Evans' book (88 points | 45 comments)
22. Judge Rules Blanket Search of Cell Tower Data Unconstitutional (399 points | 155 comments)
23. Defold: cross-platform game engine (358 points | 148 comments)
24. A puzzle of two unreliable sensors (10 points | 6 comments)
25. A New ASN.1 API for Python (155 points | 77 comments)
26. The most famous carbon dioxide absorber (145 points | 52 comments)
27. Hextraction, a free and open source board game (62 points | 12 comments)
28. Loglan'82: programming language for object-oriented and distributed programming (47 points | 6 comments)
29. Jupiter, it's mushballs all the way down (50 points | 11 comments)
30. AMP and why emails are not (and should never be) interactive (203 points | 139 comments)
